intro: Achetaria scutellarioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed scutellaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically blue to purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
